<Link id="l00479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="479"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="480"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="481"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Otherwise, see if we can internalize.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="482"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8762ebd5bf9405ac3edf4c40d8cb36a9">EnableLTOInternalization</a>)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="487"><Highlight kind="normal">      S-&gt;setLinkage(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue/#aedfa75f0c85c4aa85b257f066fbea57ca1511edd03e02d1f3dd277a3c6abf6ad5">GlobalValue::InternalLinkage</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="489"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="490"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="491"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Non-exported function and variable definitions with a weak-for-linker</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="492"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// linkage can be internalized in certain cases. The minimum legality</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="493"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// requirements would be that they are not address taken to ensure that we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="494"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// don&#39;t break pointer equality checks, and that variables are either read-</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="495"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// or write-only. For functions, this is the case if either all copies are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="496"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#91;local&#95;&#93;unnamed&#95;addr, or we can propagate reference edge attributes</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="497"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (which is how this is guaranteed for variables, when analyzing whether</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="498"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// they are read or write-only).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="499"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="500"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// However, we only get to this code for weak-for-linkage values in one of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="501"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// two cases:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="502"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1) The prevailing copy is not in IR (it is in native code).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="503"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 2) The prevailing copy in IR is not exported from its module.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="504"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Additionally, at least for the new LTO API, case 2 will only happen if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="505"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// there is exactly one definition of the value (i.e. in exactly one</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="506"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// module), as duplicate defs are result in the value being marked exported.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="507"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Likely, users of the legacy LTO API are similar, however, currently there</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="508"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// are llvm-lto based tests of the legacy LTO API that do not mark</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="509"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// duplicate linkonce&#95;odr copies as exported via the tool, so we need</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="510"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to handle that case below by checking the number of copies.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="511"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="512"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Generally, we only want to internalize a weak-for-linker value in case</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="513"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 2, because in case 1 we cannot see how the value is used to know if it</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="514"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is read or write-only. We also don&#39;t want to bloat the binary with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// multiple internalized copies of non-prevailing linkonce/weak functions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="516"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note if we don&#39;t internalize, we will convert non-prevailing copies to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="517"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// available&#95;externally anyway, so that we drop them after inlining. The</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="518"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// only reason to internalize such a function is if we indeed have a single</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="519"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// copy, because internalizing it won&#39;t increase binary size, and enables</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="520"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// use of inliner heuristics that are more aggressive in the face of a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="521"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// single call to a static (local). For variables, internalizing a read or</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00522" /><CodeLine lineNumber="522"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// write only variable can enable more aggressive optimization. However, we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="523"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// already perform this elsewhere in the ThinLTO backend handling for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="524"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// read or write-only variables (processGlobalForThinLTO).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00525" /><CodeLine lineNumber="525"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00526" /><CodeLine lineNumber="526"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Therefore, only internalize linkonce/weak if there is a single copy, that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="527"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is prevailing in this IR module. We can do so aggressively, without</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="528"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// requiring the address to be insignificant, or that a variable be read or</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="529"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// write-only.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="530"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue/#ac291102760c543c8e045e829d57d3341">GlobalValue::isWeakForLinker</a>(S-&gt;linkage()) ||</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="531"><Highlight kind="normal">        <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue/#a25e8e3490a28e9178b302b76ae643443">GlobalValue::isExternalWeakLinkage</a>(S-&gt;linkage()))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="532"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">continue</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="533"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="534"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (isPrevailing(VI.getGUID(), S.get()) &amp;&amp; ExternallyVisibleCopies == 1)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="535"><Highlight kind="normal">      S-&gt;setLinkage(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue/#aedfa75f0c85c4aa85b257f066fbea57ca1511edd03e02d1f3dd277a3c6abf6ad5">GlobalValue::InternalLinkage</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="536"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="537"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00643" /><CodeLine lineNumber="643"><Highlight kind="normal">    GlobalRes.UnnamedAddr &amp;= Sym.isUnnamedAddr();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00644" /><CodeLine lineNumber="644"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Res.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lto/symbolresolution/#a61e14815eb907619ac67d15a4cf569c9">Prevailing</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00646" /><CodeLine lineNumber="646"><Highlight kind="normal">             </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Multiple prevailing defs are not allowed&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00649" /><CodeLine lineNumber="649"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!GlobalRes.Prevailing &amp;&amp; GlobalRes.IRName.empty()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00650" /><CodeLine lineNumber="650"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Sometimes it can be two copies of symbol in a module and prevailing</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00651" /><CodeLine lineNumber="651"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// symbol can have no IR name. That might happen if symbol is defined in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00652" /><CodeLine lineNumber="652"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// module level inline asm block. In case we have multiple modules with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00653" /><CodeLine lineNumber="653"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the same symbol we want to use IR name of the prevailing symbol.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00654" /><CodeLine lineNumber="654"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Otherwise, if we haven&#39;t seen a prevailing symbol, set the name so that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00657" /><CodeLine lineNumber="657"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00658" /><CodeLine lineNumber="658"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00659" /><CodeLine lineNumber="659"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In rare occasion, the symbol used to initialize GlobalRes has a different</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00660" /><CodeLine lineNumber="660"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// IRName from the inspected Symbol. This can happen on macOS + iOS, when a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00661" /><CodeLine lineNumber="661"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// symbol is referenced through its mangled name, say @&quot;\\01&#95;symbol&quot; while</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00662" /><CodeLine lineNumber="662"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the IRName is @symbol (the prefix underscore comes from MachO mangling).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00663" /><CodeLine lineNumber="663"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In that case, we have the same actual Symbol that can get two different</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00664" /><CodeLine lineNumber="664"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// GUID, leading to some invalid internalization. Workaround this by marking</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00665" /><CodeLine lineNumber="665"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the GlobalRes external.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00666" /><CodeLine lineNumber="666"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00667" /><CodeLine lineNumber="667"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME: instead of this check, it would be desirable to compute GUIDs</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00668" /><CodeLine lineNumber="668"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// based on mangled name, but this requires an access to the Target Triple</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00670" /><CodeLine lineNumber="670"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (GlobalRes.IRName != Sym.getIRName()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00804" /><CodeLine lineNumber="804"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="805"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Checks whether the given global value is in a non-prevailing comdat</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00806" /><CodeLine lineNumber="806"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (comdat containing values the linker indicated were not prevailing,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00807" /><CodeLine lineNumber="807"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// which we then dropped to available&#95;externally), and if so, removes</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00808" /><CodeLine lineNumber="808"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// it from the comdat. This is called for all global values to ensure the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00809" /><CodeLine lineNumber="809"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// comdat is empty rather than leaving an incomplete comdat. It is needed for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00810" /><CodeLine lineNumber="810"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// regular LTO modules, in case we are in a mixed-LTO mode (both regular</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00811" /><CodeLine lineNumber="811"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and thin LTO modules) compilation. Since the regular LTO module will be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00812" /><CodeLine lineNumber="812"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// linked first in the final native link, we want to make sure the linker</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00813" /><CodeLine lineNumber="813"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// doesn&#39;t select any of these incomplete comdats that would be left</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00814" /><CodeLine lineNumber="814"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// in the regular LTO module without this cleanup.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00815" /><CodeLine lineNumber="815"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00816" /><CodeLine lineNumber="816" lineLink="#a4f0167f2ae072a399680c468a9777221"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="#a4f0167f2ae072a399680c468a9777221">handleNonPrevailingComdat</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue">GlobalValue</a> &amp;GV,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="817"><Highlight kind="normal">                          std::set&lt;const Comdat &#42;&gt; &amp;NonPrevailingComdats) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="821"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="822"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!NonPrevailingComdats.count(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cafd841a49aec1539bc88abc8ff9e170fb">C</a>))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="823"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="824"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1537"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This backend is utilized in the first round of a two-codegen round process.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1538"><Highlight kind="comment">/// It first saves optimized bitcode files to disk before the codegen process</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1539"><Highlight kind="comment">/// begins. After codegen, it stores the resulting object files in a scratch</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1540"><Highlight kind="comment">/// buffer. Note the codegen data stored in the scratch buffer will be extracted</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1541"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and merged in the subsequent step.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1542" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-lto-cpp-/firstroundthinbackend"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-lto-cpp-/firstroundthinbackend/#a403bfe19b112f4d389639e754930b37c">FirstRoundThinBackend</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-lto-cpp-/inprocessthinbackend/#ac623fd2d132c0a19c1b96c76a0821b92">InProcessThinBackend</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01631" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1631"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This backend operates in the second round of a two-codegen round process.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1632"><Highlight kind="comment">/// It starts by reading the optimized bitcode files that were saved during the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1633"><Highlight kind="comment">/// first round. The backend then executes the codegen only to further optimize</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01634" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1634"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the code, utilizing the codegen data merged from the first round. Finally,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01635" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1635"><Highlight kind="comment">/// it writes the resulting object files as usual.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2019"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (BackendProcess-&gt;getThreadCount() == 1 ||</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2022"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// command-line. It is important for this codepath to be used for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2026"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> = 0, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#abb2b3a60ccc38a28239e19a1646e0c8a">E</a> = ModuleMap.size(); <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> != <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#abb2b3a60ccc38a28239e19a1646e0c8a">E</a>; ++<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2030"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When executing in parallel, process largest bitsize modules first to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2032"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This saves about 15 sec on a 36-core machine while link &#96;clang.exe&#96;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2051"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2052"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Perform two rounds of code generation for ThinLTO:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2053"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1 First round: Perform optimization and code generation, outputting to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2054"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// temporary scratch objects.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2055"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 2 Merge code generation data extracted from the temporary scratch objects.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2056"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 3 Second round: Execute code generation again using the merged data.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2057"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;&#91;TwoRounds&#93; Initializing ThinLTO two-codegen rounds\\n&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2059"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MaxTasks = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto/#ac0010e13022065d0cb4a16df7547a232">getMaxTasks</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2061"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Set up two additional streams and caches for storing temporary scratch</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2069"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> FirstRoundLTO = std::make&#95;unique&lt;FirstRoundThinBackend&gt;(</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2072"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac226f3d2b9ca090171a8e0a8cb92c343a902b0d55fddef6f8d651fe1035b7d4bd">Error</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#abb2b3a60ccc38a28239e19a1646e0c8a">E</a> = RunBackends(FirstRoundLTO.get()))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2073"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#abb2b3a60ccc38a28239e19a1646e0c8a">E</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2076"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CombinedHashOrErr = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/cgdata/#a05b4c070c172287759f5f2f437a3edcb">cgdata::mergeCodeGenData</a>(&#42;CG.getResult());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2077"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac226f3d2b9ca090171a8e0a8cb92c343a902b0d55fddef6f8d651fe1035b7d4bd">Error</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#abb2b3a60ccc38a28239e19a1646e0c8a">E</a> = CombinedHashOrErr.takeError())</Highlight></CodeLine>
